page.title: 02COAST-HOLKER MOSS
page.content: The estuary of the rivers{Crake}and {Leven}takes the form of a large area of{sand and mud-flats.}The tide floods the estuary twice a day in a great rush of water which takes about half an hour to cover the mud-flats. Around the estuary man has built many {embankments}in order to reclaim the low-lying land.This land is now used for grazing purposes.A few trees have been planted,especially as windbreaks around buildings. Wading birds feed on the mud-flats at low tide.Many fish live in the water and it is a popular fishing area. The{river channels}are constantly changing due to the effect of tide,river floods and winter storms.The channels were recently altered due to the effect of the building of a new road bridge a short distance upstream.
